chapter.p: 1Ask rain from Yahweh in the season of the spring rain—

ul.li1: Yahweh, who makes storm clouds,
and he gives showers of rain to them,
ul.li2: to everyone vegetation in the field.
ul.li1: 2Because the household godsHebrew teraphim speak deceit,
ul.li2: and those who practice divination see a lie,
ul.li1: and the dreamers of vanity speak in vain.
ul.li2: Therefore the people wander like sheep;Or “flocks”; the Hebrew term refers collectively to both sheep and goats (small livestock animals)
ul.li1: they are afflicted because there is no shepherd.
3My anger burnsLiterally “My nose becomes hot” against the shepherds,
ul.li2: and I will punish the leaders,Or “male goats”
ul.li1: because Yahweh of hosts watches over his flock,Or “herd”
ul.li2: the house of Judah;
ul.li3: and he will make them like his majestic horse in war.
ul.li1: 4From themHebrew “him” (or “it”), referring to the flock in v. 3 the cornerstone will go out,
ul.li2: from themHebrew “him” (or “it”), referring to the flock in v. 3 the tent peg,
ul.li1: from themHebrew “him” (or “it”), referring to the flock in v. 3 the battle bow,
ul.li2: from themHebrew “him” (or “it”), referring to the flock in v. 3 every ruler,
ul.li1: 5And they will be like warriors,
ul.li2: trampling in the mud of the streets in the battle.
ul.li1: They will fight, because Yahweh is with them,
ul.li2: and they will put to shame the riders on horses.
ul.li1: 6And I will strengthen the house of Judah,
ul.li2: and the house of Joseph I will save.
ul.li1: And I will bring them back, because I have compassion on them,
ul.li2: and they will be as if I had not rejected them,
for I am Yahweh their God, and I will answer them.
ul.li1: 7And the people of Ephraim will be like a warrior,
ul.li2: and their heart will be glad as with wine.
ul.li1: And their children will see and rejoice;
ul.li2: their heart will shout in exultation in Yahweh.
ul.li1: 8I will whistle to them and gather them,
ul.li2: for I have redeemed them,
and they will become numerous as they have been numerous before.
ul.li1: 9Though I sowOr “scatter” them among the nations,
ul.li2: in the distant places they will remember me,
and they will stay alive with their children, and they will return.
ul.li1: 10And I will bring them back from the land of Egypt,
ul.li2: and from Assyria I will gather them.
ul.li1: To the land of Gilead and Lebanon I will bring them,
ul.li2: until no room will be found for them there.
ul.li1: 11And heLXX reads “they,” referring to the Israelites (so NIV, NRSV, NASB) will pass through the sea of distress,
ul.li2: and he will strike the waves of the sea,
and all the depths of the Nile will dry up.
ul.li1: The pride of Assyria will be brought low,
ul.li2: and the scepter of Egypt will depart.
ul.li1: 12I will make them strong in Yahweh,
ul.li2: and in his name they will walk,
